hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversion After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: Following liquidity-focused news headlines (like Strategy Inc. shift), BTC/USD order book liquidity gaps (bid-ask spread > 0.15%) will revert to baseline within 2 hours with 70% probability when overall market regime is NEUTRAL.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes exhibit mean-reverting microstructure - liquidity providers quickly fill gaps when news creates temporary imbalances without fundamental shifts. Recent headlines create noise but not structural change.
entry_conditions: BTC/USD 1-minute bid-ask spread exceeds 0.15% (vs 30-day median of 0.08%)
News sentiment score (crypto liquidity keywords) > 0.7 within past 30 minutes
BTC 5-minute volume ratio (current/20-period avg) < 1.2 (no volume confirmation)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Spread returns to within 0.02% of 30-day median

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of trades show spread expansion persisting beyond 2 hours with statistical significance (p<0.05) in neutral regimes.
